1: Job resumed speaking and he said,\q
2:
"As surely as God lives, who has taken away my justice,\q the Almighty, who made my life bitter,
\q
4: My lips will not speak wickedness,\q neither will my tongue speak deceit;
5:
I will never admit that you three are right;\q until I die I will never deny my integrity.


\q
6:
I hold fast to my righteousness and will not let it go;\q my thoughts will not reproach me so long as I live.
\q
7:
Let my enemy be like a wicked man;\q let him who rises up against me be like an unrighteous man.


\q
8:
For what is the hope of a godless man when God cuts him off,\q when God takes away his life?
\q
9:
Will God hear his cry\q when trouble comes upon him?
\q
10:
Will he delight himself in the Almighty\q and call upon God at all times?


\q
11:
I will teach you concerning the hand of God;\q I will not conceal the thoughts of the Almighty.
\q
12:
See, all of you have seen this yourselves;\q why then have you spoken all this nonsense?


\q
13:
This is the portion of a wicked man with God,\q the heritage of the oppressor that he receives from the Almighty:
\q
14:
If his children multiply, it is for the sword;\q his offspring will never have enough food.


\q
15:
Those who survive him will be buried by plague,\q and their widows will make no lament for them.
\q
16:
Though the wicked man heaps up silver like the dust,\q and heaps up clothing like clay,
\q
17:
he may heap up clothing, but righteous people will put it on,\q and innocent people will divide up the silver among themselves.


\q
18:
He builds his house like a spider,\q like a hut that a guard makes.
\q
19:
He lies down in bed rich, but he will not keep doing so;\q he opens his eyes, and everything is gone.


\q
20:
Terrors overtake him like waters;\q a storm takes him away in the night.
\q
21:
The east wind carries him away, and he leaves;\q it sweeps him out of his place.


\q
22:
It throws itself at him and does not stop;\q he tries to flee out of its hand.
\q
23: It claps its hands at him in mockery;\q it hisses him out of his place.
